column4: can someone help me ssh? im getting operation timed out and the server has port 22 open
firewall?
isnt ssh to cinrcumvent my (remote) firewall?
how?
if theres a  firewall between your pc and router(iptables)..it'll block port 22
if its a timeout..it has to do something with the firewall/port forwarding
of course not!
it has to listen on the wan interface
127.0.0.1 is for local connections...to get connected from internet..ssh has to listen on a wan interface
any chance you ip back home changed?..and do you have an auto ip update client installed back home
no client yet but ip hasnt changed. I can still vnc into it
if u can vnc...then please login back home..and check if 22 is open?
it is. locally and remotely
am i bothering u too much with my suggestions/questions?
no not at all, ust replying to many ppls
try this : dig XXX.dyndns.org and then try ssh <ipaddress that is returned by dig >
vnc, bittorent work on ports higher than 1056...which are not checked by default by most routers!
what do you mean "not checked?
dyndns could be seeing port 22 open on your router..not necessarily on your server?
port 22 is open on the server (127.0.0.1) and from external ip check from internet
if u can somehow get to your server...give us the output of " sudo iptables -L" , "netstat -ltunp"
and im saying that based on u saying u can vnc home
